title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 340.3 - Attribution of past joint obligations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 340.3 - Attribution of past joint obligations

State Regulations

For purposes of Executive Law section 296-a(4)(b), a
response to a request for a separate credit history, made after July 15, 1974, shall include all obligations, whenever entered into, as to which the creditor
or credit reporting bureau then has information in its files. In creating such
a separate history, all obligations on which two parties were jointly liable
shall be reported as the obligation of each, irrespective of the actual source
of payments. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
340.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
